title.narrative: WASH EMERGENCY PREPARDNESS AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: By 2018, at least 35,000 people, in particular women and children affected by emergencies have adequate access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation and adopt good hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2016 - Outcome 4 / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): By 2016, populations in provinces with low access to potable water and basic sanitation have an improved access to these services and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, at least 35,000 people, in particular women and children affected by emergencies have adequate access to safe drinkingwater and basic sanitation and adopt good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: In 2018, 87,211 people affected by humanitarian situations were reached with safe drinking water and 493,991 people with hygiene promotion messages. As co-lead of the emergency WASH sector UNICEF Burundi continued to improve the coordination of humanitarian preparedness and response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene

Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies are in place
